intro: Ottonia taperana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ottonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, fern-like leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are small and white, clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Ottonia taperana is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats.
